result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew A. McCracken was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

Defendant Mathew A. McCracken in court with attorney Kyle Robert Reimann.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites joint recommendation: $465.60 .    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  Defendant sworn by the Clerk.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation.  Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 14, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
